availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac P. Marvin (Pendleton County, Kentucky, teacher, )

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, teacher. New York native. Son of William Marvin and Mary S. Marvin. Married to Maria Woodworth Marvin in Pendleton County in 1857. Father of Annie L. Marvin and Mary T. Marvin. Student in Bethany, New York, in 1850. Schoolteacher in Falmouth, Kentucky, in 1860. Teacher in Pendleton County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, New York, Genesee County, Bethany, p. 119B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Falmouth, p. 436.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Falmouth, p. 411B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, 1855-1868, Film #000272801, p. 291, p. 781 of 942 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Pendleton County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 303, p. 118 of 485 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
